org.gbif.metrics.cube

Class HBaseCubes<O extends com.urbanairship.datacube.Op>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.metrics.cube.HBaseCubes<O>

  • public class HBaseCubes<O extends com.urbanairship.datacube.Op>
extends Object
    This is a utility class to simplify dealing with the HBase CubeIo IO. Depending on usage, sometimes you need access to the underlying Pool of HTables, to control for example auto flushing. This class is intended to simplify those operations by providing a simpler API than those provided by the underlying HBase and DataCube libraries. There are 2 key scenarios typically you want to run DataCube in:
    1. In a backfill to populate a new table, where certain optimizations can be made
    2. In live read write mode
    Note: Decision was to use separate table per cube and per lookup (to enable easy truncating by cube), hence uniqueCubeName is empty in the idService and the hbaseHarness. This is a decision that might be revisited in the future.

      • newIncrementingBatchAsync

        public static <O extends com.urbanairship.datacube.Op> HBaseCubes<O> newIncrementingBatchAsync(com.urbanairship.datacube.DataCube<O> cube,
                                                                               com.urbanairship.datacube.Deserializer<O> deserializer,

                                                                               org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                                                               int writeBatchSize,
                                                                               int numFlushThreads)
                                                                                    throws IOException
        Creates a new batch writing instance that will modify any existing data in the cube by doing an increment call. This is therefore ONLY suitable for Op that supports increment, such as IntOp and LongOp.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • newOverwritingBatchAsync

        public static <O extends com.urbanairship.datacube.Op> HBaseCubes<O> newOverwritingBatchAsync(com.urbanairship.datacube.DataCube<O> cube,
                                                                              com.urbanairship.datacube.Deserializer<O> deserializer,
                                                                              byte[] cubeTable,
                                                                              byte[] lookupTable,
                                                                              byte[] counterTable,
                                                                              byte[] cf,
                                                                              @Nullable
                                                                              org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                                                              int writeBatchSize)
                                                                                   throws IOException
        Creates a new batch writing instance that will overwrite any existing data in the cube. Note that following writes, clients must call closeQuietly(), or close() in order to flush all pending commits to HBase. Particularly suited to backfill tasks.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public void write(com.urbanairship.datacube.Batch<O> batch)
           throws IllegalStateException,
                  com.urbanairship.datacube.AsyncException,
                  InterruptedException
        Utility to write a batch to the cube. NOTE: This is for advanced users only, and requires an understanding of DataCube internals. For example, one must know that this ONLY works for the Batch_Async mode.
        Parameters:
        batch - To perform
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Should this be called with the wrong sync level
        com.urbanairship.datacube.AsyncException
        InterruptedException

      • write

        public void write(O op,
         com.urbanairship.datacube.WriteBuilder wb)
           throws com.urbanairship.datacube.AsyncException,
                  InterruptedException,
                  IOException
        Utility to simplify writes, by calling the appropriate write or writeAsync
        Throws:
        com.urbanairship.datacube.AsyncException - only if using the ASync mode
        InterruptedException
        IOException
